alert.note: Alert for Henry; Rock Island (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 26 at 5:02PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Rock Island, northwestern Henry and southeastern Scott Counties through 600 PM CDT... At 501 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Milan, or over Moline, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, minor flooding and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could cause minor tree limb damage and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Slowing or redirecting of traffic due to ponding or flowing water. Closure of waterfront access due to flooding. Locations impacted include... Davenport, Moline, Rock Island, Bettendorf, East Moline, Silvis, Colona, Milan, Coal Valley, Hampton, Orion, Rapids City, Riverdale, Oak Grove, Cleveland, Warner, Osborn, Dayton, Carbon Cliff, and Osco. This includes the following highways... Interstate 74 in Iowa near mile marker 5. Interstate 80 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 15. Interstate 74 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 20. Interstate 88 between mile markers 1 and 7. Interstate 280 between mile markers 11 and 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
